instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook retina 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
1. The audio was crackling and making bizarre sounds. Now after taking out the motherboard there is NO audio/sound at all coming out of the speakers.
2. The sound icon is blurred out.

No water damage.
Anyone had the same problem?


UPDATE: 

1. I found corrosion on Audio codec IC <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>, 5v on input but only 1.2v on output. The output should be 4.5v. 
2. I desolder <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and one pin was broken under. I patched that pad back with solder. 
3. Since I don't have the same board or IC here I will order a new one and revert back with an update when I have. No point to look for short, since the IC was not outputting correct voltage, I can determine its the bad part. Meantime I post some images for everyone's reference.

threads.title: Macbook retina 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Macbook retina 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Very very likely a bad <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>. One from a Retina Pro donor board will do the trick make sure same year board 13/15" does not seem to matter.
